statement: Here is an interesting factoid: "On the planet Earth, if there are at least 23 people in a room, the chance that two of them have the same birthday is greater than 50%." You would like to come up with more factoids of this form. Given two integers (minOdds and daysInYear), your method should return the fewest number of people (from a planet where there are daysInYear days in each year) needed such that you can be at least minOdds% sure that two of the people have the same birthday. See example 0 for further information.

notes.val: Two people can have the same birthday without being born in the same year.
You may assume that the odds of being born on a particular day are (1 / ).
You may assume that there are no leap years.

constraints.val: minOdds will be between 1 and 99, inclusive.
daysInYear will be between 1 and 10000, inclusive.

For any number of people N, the odds that two people will have the same birthday (in a room with N people, on a planet with daysInYear days in each year) will not be within 1e-9 of minOdds. (In other words, you don't need to worry about floating-point precision for this problem.)
